newsitem.title: BRAZIL: BankBoston's Brazil unit names president.
newsitem.headline: BankBoston's Brazil unit names president.

text.p: BankBoston Corp's Brazilian unit on Tuesday said it named Geraldo Carbone as its president, replacing Carlos Craide, who has left the company.
Carbone, who joined BankBoston in 1991, most recently served as vice president. Previously he headed the bank's macroeconomic analysis and asset management departments,
Craide, formerly with Citicorp's Citibank Brazil, is leaving BankBoston after 10 months to take over as general manager of ING Barings Brazil.
Craide had replaced Henrique Meirelles, who was named BankBoston's president and chief operating officer in July 1996.
